title: WebKit Security Response Manager
summary: Join us in building the best, most secure browser engine! We’re looking for a person to manage a team of software engineers who make sure we respond quickly and correctly to security bugs. The team will use tools and technologies to eradicate whole classes of security issues.
description: In this role, you will manage a team that fixes security bugs and works strategically to prevent security issues. You’ll collaborate across teams across Apple to drive security improvements in our browser and the underlying platforms, and interact with developers outside Apple on the WebKit Open Source project.
key_qualifications: Experience with mentoring, career development, project planning, and executive reporting. Strong understanding of the kinds of security issues that arise in C++ and how to address them. Technical understanding of software release schedules.
education_experience: BS in Computer Science or equivalent education or work experience
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $208,300 and $360,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.
